intro: Schizoglossum nitidum, commonly known as the smooth-tongue plant, is a small, herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, terminal inflorescences, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Schizoglossum nitidum is often found in woodland areas and is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley.
